description: This chapter focuses on the story of Elimelech's family moving to Moab during a famine in Judah, the deaths of the men in the family, and Naomi's return to Bethlehem with Ruth, her Moabite daughter-in-law.

questions.question: What happened in the days when the judges ruled?
options: There was war in the land
There was a famine in the land
There was disease in the land
There was flooding in the land

questions.question: Where did the man of Beth-lehem-judah go to sojourn?
Who went with the man to sojourn in the country of Moab?
options: He, and his wife, and his two sons

questions.question: What was the name of the man?
What was the name of Elimelech's wife?
What was the name of one of Elimelech's two sons?
What was the name of Elimelech's other son?
What were Elimelech's family called as inhabitants of Beth-lehem-judah?
What happened to Elimelech, Naomi's husband?
Who was left after Elimelech died?
options: She was left, and her two sons

questions.question: From what group did Mahlon and Chilion take wives?
What was the name of one of the wives?
What was the name of the other wife?
How long did Mahlon and Chilion dwell in the country of Moab?
Who died after living in Moab?
options: Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them

questions.question: What was the woman's situation after the deaths?
options: The woman was left of her two sons and her husband

questions.question: What had Naomi heard in the country of Moab?
options: How that the LORD had visited his people in giving them bread

questions.question: What did Naomi do after hearing this news?
options: Then she arose with her daughters in law, that she might return from the country of Moab

questions.question: Who went with Naomi when she went forth from where she was?
options: Her two daughters in law with her

questions.question: Where were they going to return to?
What did Naomi tell her daughters-in-law to do?
options: Go, return each to her mother's house

questions.question: How did Naomi say they had dealt with the dead and with her?
Where did Naomi pray the LORD would grant them to find rest?
options: Each of you in the house of her husband

questions.question: What did Naomi do after speaking these words?
What did they do after she kissed them?
options: They lifted up their voice, and wept

questions.question: What did the daughters-in-law say to Naomi?
options: We will go to our homes
Surely we will return with thee unto thy people

questions.question: How did Naomi address her daughters-in-law?
What question did Naomi ask about having more sons?
options: Are there yet any more sons in my womb, that they may be your husbands?
Where do you want to go?

questions.question: What did Naomi say about her age?
options: I am too old to have an husband

questions.question: What question did Naomi ask about waiting for sons to grow up?
options: Would ye tarry for them till they were grown?

questions.question: Why did Naomi say she was grieved?
options: For it grieveth me much for your sakes that the hand of the LORD is gone out against me

questions.question: What did they do after hearing Naomi's words?
options: They lifted up their voice, and wept again

questions.question: What did Orpah do?
options: Orpah kissed her mother in law

questions.question: What did Ruth do?
Where did Naomi tell Ruth her sister-in-law had gone back to?
options: Thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods

questions.question: What did Ruth say to Naomi about leaving her?
options: Intreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee
I will go with my sister-in-law

questions.question: In Ruth's famous declaration, what did she say about where Naomi goes?
options: For whither thou goest, I will go

questions.question: What did Ruth say about Naomi's people?
options: Your people shall be my friends
Thy people shall be my people
Your people shall be my relatives
Your people shall be my brothers

questions.question: Where did Ruth say she would die?
options: Where thou diest, will I die

questions.question: When did Naomi and Ruth come to Beth-lehem?
options: In the beginning of wheat harvest
In the beginning of barley harvest
